intro: Ritchiea fragariodora var. plurinervis, commonly known as the multi-veined Ritchiea, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants characterized by their spathaceous inflorescences. The plant features a rhizomatous stem with broad, heart-shaped leaves that have prominent, parallel veins. Its flowers are small and clustered within a spathe, typical of the arum family. The varietal form plurinervis is distinguished by its more complex and numerous venation patterns in the foliage.
